title: Lenovo Legion Go S leaks again, Legion Glasses 2 tag along
description: Earlier this month the upcoming Lenovo Legion Go S handheld gaming PC leaked, and today some more colorful renders of it have been outed. The Go S is rumored to come with a smaller screen than the original Legion Go which launched last year, and the detachable controllers are gone. Lenovo Legion Go S newly leaked images It has 18 buttons, dual front-facing speakers, rear-facing fans, and two USB-C ports, both located on the top side. excerpt: These are probably launching soon. Earlier this month the upcoming Lenovo Legion Go S handheld gaming PC leaked, and today some more colorful renders of it...
text: Earlier this month the upcoming Lenovo Legion Go S handheld gaming PC leaked, and today some more colorful renders of it have been outed. The Go S is rumored to come with a smaller screen than the original Legion Go which launched last year, and the detachable controllers are gone. Lenovo Legion Go S newly leaked images It has 18 buttons, dual front-facing speakers, rear-facing fans, and two USB-C ports, both located on the top side. The Legion Go S will allegedly be powered by AMD's Ryzen Z2, with Zen 3-plus cores so a step below the Zen 4 cores in the Z1 Extreme powering the original Legion Go and the Asus ROG Ally, one of its main competitors along with the Steam Deck. Lenovo Legion Glasses 2 leaked images Interestingly, it looks like Lenovo is also preparing to launch the Legion Glasses 2 alongside the Legion Go S, so a Legion event is definitely coming up soon. We'll keep you posted on new developments. Source
html:
Earlier this month the upcoming Lenovo Legion Go S handheld gaming PC leaked, and today some more colorful renders of it have been outed.

The Go S is rumored to come with a smaller screen than the original Legion Go which launched last year, and the detachable controllers are gone.


Lenovo Legion Go S newly leaked images

It has 18 buttons, dual front-facing speakers, rear-facing fans, and two USB-C ports, both located on the top side. The Legion Go S will allegedly be powered by AMD's Ryzen Z2, with Zen 3-plus cores so a step below the Zen 4 cores in the Z1 Extreme powering the original Legion Go and the Asus ROG Ally, one of its main competitors along with the Steam Deck.


Lenovo Legion Glasses 2 leaked images

Interestingly, it looks like Lenovo is also preparing to launch the Legion Glasses 2 alongside the Legion Go S, so a Legion event is definitely coming up soon. We'll keep you posted on new developments.

Source
